Key Match Events: Jackson Chourio hit a tiebreaking solo homer in the ninth inning.
Aaron Ashby pitched two scoreless innings for the win.
Devin Williams worked a shaky ninth for his eighth save.
Jake Bauers made a diving stop of Ty France’s hard grounder for the final out.
Blake Perkins robbed Noelvi Marte of a potential go-ahead homer with a terrific leaping grab for the final out of the sixth.
Willy Adames hit a three-run drive in the third inning.
Spencer Steer hit a two-run single in the fifth.
Amed Rosario connected for a tying two-run homer in the sixth.
Post-Match Reflections: Brewers manager Pat Murphy said, 'We’re not saying we’re more talented than other teams, we’re just finding a way with somebody different every night. We’re confident in everybody.'
Jackson Chourio said, 'All I really had in my mind in that moment was finding a way to get on base, finding a way to help the team. I like being in those situations, where you can help the team win.'
Reds manager David Bell said, 'The Brewers did what they had to do tonight, great plays, great swings, and good pitching. They’re good.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Milwaukee Brewers reduced their magic number to 16 for clinching the NL Central title.
Milwaukee became the third team to reach 80 wins this season, joining the Dodgers and Phillies.
Others: Brewers RHP Nick Mears (right forearm inflammation) is expected to resume playing catch when the Brewers return home next week.

Reds INF/OF Santiago Espinal was out of the lineup after fouling a ball off his left shin in the second game of Friday’s doubleheader. Manager David Bell said there is no fracture and Espinal was available to hit.
Brewers RHP Tobias Myers (6-5, 2.99 ERA) starts the series finale on Sunday. He has a 2.20 ERA in his past 14 starts. The Reds have not announced a starter.
